Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Highly porous nanoparticles with angstrom scale sieving channels

Other Information.Additional Info: Hydrated proton (e.g., H3O+) can pass through the 5 Å pores in UIO-66OSO3

Other Information.Test Conditions: 298 K, 1.5 M VO2+ + 3 M H2SO4 solution
Other Information.Additional Info: Vanadium ions are screened out by the 5 Å pores in UIO-66OSO3

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Vanadium permeability: 7.88 × 10^-9 cm2 s−1, Area resistance: 0.23 Ω cm−2

Other Information.Additional Info: The sulfated groups on UIO-66OSO3 provide numerous angstrom-scale sieving channels and enhance proton conductivity while repelling vanadium ions.
Protons are transported through 5 Å pores in UIO-66OSO3 and nanoscale ionic clusters (~8 nm)

Other Information.Test Conditions: 298 K, 1.5 M VO2+ + 3 M H2SO4 solution
Other Information.Additional Info: Vanadium ions are excluded by the 5 Å pores in UIO-66OSO3

Experimental Validation.Method: Breakthrough experiment, electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS), VRFB cycling test
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Energy efficiency: 86.1%, Discharge capacity decay rate: 0.15% per cycle

Other Information.Additional Info: The PBIU membrane exhibits excellent chemical stability and maintains performance over 2000 cycles (>2500 h) without morphological or chemical changes.
